page.title: 17POPULATION:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: Both parishes now have small popu- lations,171 in Bedingham in 1981,172 in Hedenham.This compares with 293 in Bedingham in 1881 & 281 in Hedenham; but in spite of the changes in recent years,some 30% of the people are from families who have lived here or nearby for 2 generations or more.Bedingham had 8 under-5s,37 of 5-16 years,111 between 16-64,15 at 65+ (1 85+) in 1981;Hedenham was similar with 11 0-4 years old, 31 of school age,& 130 adults,17 being over 64 (4 over 85). The dramatic drop in population,partly caused by farm mechanisation,has meant non-viable{schools;}Bedingham's was closed 1906,Hedenham's 1947-50 so children travel outside the area;they mostly go to County Primary Schools at Woodton or Ditchingham & for secondary education to High Schools at Loddon, Norwich,Framingham Earl or Bungay.
